body.p: To his Excellancy the Governor of the State of Kentucky

Your petitioner would respectfully state that he is the keeper of a small Coffee house situated at the Corner of Flay & Market Street that about two Months Since he was Considerable annoyed by a boy throwing Sand dirt & even rocks into his Bar Room -- that he requested sd boy to desist which the boy would not do. The annoyance was so great that it was necessary for your petitioner to have it stopped Consequently he was obliged to get rid of the anoyance as best he Could hence he had to drive sd boy out of his bar room that he did not use any violence whatever. Still sd boy was induced by his Mother to have your petitioner indicted ^for assault & battery^ on the City Court. That by the testimony of sd boy & his Mother the jury at the trial of the the Cause which occured and the 6th day of October 1862 assessed the fine against your petitioner at twenty five dollars. Your petitioner was not aware at the time of the trial that some facts whereon to ^by sd boy^ were not true otherwise he would have forewarned the attendance of witnesses who been since the trial have informed him that these certain facts were not true. This information he acquired too late to be of any use to him whatever.

Your petitioner would respectfully state that he has a family of five small children a wife depending on him for a support -- that he is illy able to pay such a fine inasmuch as his business though at best has a small one has been very much injured by the recent order requiring Coffee Houses to be closed. Your petitioner would respectfully ask your Excellancy to
interpose by remitting the same as if he be compelled to pay the same it will be a great hardship & as in duty bound will ever pray
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 14th day of October 1862
Jos Clement, Justice of the peace Jeff Co Ky

We the undersigned Citizens of the City of Louisville are personally acquainted with the petitioner Conrad Koll ^& know^ that he is a clever quiet and orderly, and loyal Citizen that we believe the statements made in his peitition are true & that he is deserving of Executive clemency

Pettn of E. Rott to remit fine
Read not granted
